content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had a conversation with Max Müller.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was the rental price for an apartment in Duisburg.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: No, we did not agree on a final price.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: If yes what was the final price? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: Since we did not agree on a final price, I cannot provide an exact number. The conversation ended with Max Müller offering 700 euros, but I was not convinced that this reflected the true value of the apartment. I suggested that Max reconsider his offer, but we did not reach a mutual agreement.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: As Peter Schmidt, I would rate Max Müller's likeability as a negotiation partner as a 6. While he was respectful and willing to negotiate, he did not seem to fully appreciate the value of the apartment, which led to us not reaching a final agreement.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: No, I did not feel discriminated or offended at any point during the negotiation. Max Müller conducted himself professionally, and our discussion remained focused on the terms of the rental agreement.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: If yes, why did you feel being discriminated or offended?
name: Evaluator
